name: $deviceIdentifier
desc: Returns: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

name: $::name
desc: Returns: Name of device as used in labeling or catalog.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Name of device as used in labeling or catalog.

name: $jurisdiction
desc: Returns: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a  jurisdiction.  All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace. with the appropriate repository uri as the system.  For example,  UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is  http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a  jurisdiction.  All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace. with the appropriate repository uri as the system.  For example,  UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA,

name: $carrierHRF
desc: Returns: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.

name: $carrierAIDC
desc: Returns: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - E.g a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - E.g a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need

name: $issuer
desc:
Returns: Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices.  For example, the US FDA issuers include :
1) GS1: 
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices.  For example, the US FDA issuers include :
1) GS1: 
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers:
http://hl7.org/

name: $entryType
desc: Returns: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.
